oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Stars were formerly people. Some details regarding their singing. The opening of flowers from their buds compared with the former ways of the star. In the Katkop dialect, by Dia!kwain (L.V.-21. 5660-5668, and 5661 rev.-5663, rev., note). Stars resemble the Moon and used to be people. The stars resemble the budding flowers on trees. The stars burn like little fires. 1) p.5659v: Dia!kwain heard this from his paternal grandmother (Ttuobbo-ken !kauk'si), 2) p.5660v: about the ||garraken bulb (dug up by people), 3) p.5666v: two names for 'another star': !gaunu and !guonni, 4) See also The great star !gaunu, which singing named the stars and !gaunu and A song sung by the star !gaunu, especially by the Bushman women, 5) This story is found in Book V-21.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Stars and flowers
